{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a fracture of the supracondylar humerus. This is an injury to the upper arm bone. The inability to flex the interphalangeal joint of the thumb suggests that the median nerve, which runs from the elbow down to the hand and controls the thenar muscles of the thumb, is most likely injured. Therefore, the correct answer is A: Median nerve.", "answer_choice": "A"}
